items.content_html:
Description

After #19901, the for...of page no longer shows const in its syntax box, but uses prose to define it. It's later ported to #20112. This syncs for...in with both.

This also removed a mention of "planning to remove the syntax" because it's standardized and not planned anymore.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Align for...in syntax and page structure with for...of

items.content_html:
Description

Fix mistake in description of devtools.panels.create().

Motivation

Make documentation correct.

Additional details

Chromium

Chrome docs state:

iconPath
Path of the panel's icon relative to the extension directory.
pagePath
Path of the panel's HTML page relative to the extension directory.

Safari

Safari 16 Beta Release Notes list under "Safari Web Extensions > New Features" there is "Added support for Safari Web Inspector Extensions", which most likely includes this method. I did not find documentation about Safari 16 behavior so I tested Safari Technology Preview 153 (future Safari 16.0) and it used paths relative to manifest.json (like Chrome). I created this project for testing.

Note: some popular DevTools extensions seem to work around this difference by placing the DevTools background page into the same folder as manifest.json.

Related issues and pull requests

This difference discussed in W3C WebExtensions working group: w3c/webextensions#270
items.title: Clarify devtools.panels.create() path resolution

items.content_html:
Was trying to see if some of the code block languages could be skipped like bad-example, but I found this option as a temporary workaround.
With this, only 1100 files are changes currently running accross the entire repo vs 7K with it set to "auto".
Long term it would be good to opt back in with a custom parser that could help skip some of the blocks

items.content_html:
Description

  • Remove section about trailing slash, it's conflicting with Prettier #20523
    It seems that there was already comment about if the section is relevant or not.
  • Add section about format, copied from Javascript code style page
  • Added heading "Complete HTML document"
    This is not so clear change, but I feel it's highly confusing that there are "general guidelines" and then it's said that these only affect small subset of examples. When I first reading this page, it seemed to say that these general guidelines do not affect if you are just having snippet of code. This change can be dropped off from this PR, if it does not fit.
items.title: HTML code style: No trailing slash, add note about prettier

items.content_html:
Description

  • Add live sample to show the result in the browser, replacing "rendering in your browser" for some examples.
  • Remove "sample rendering" for some examples, the only exception being <mfenced> which is not intended to be supported by browsers in the future, so it's still useful show how it was supposed to render.
  • Use display="block" for MathML examples, so they show up more "beautifully" (centered in their own line with optimization on readability).
  • Add a hidden link to math web font for some of them, to ensure that stretchy characters can display correctly.
  • Adjust indentation and spacing.
  • Other minimal tweaks of the examples (adding background to spacing elements, add click instruction to maction, split token element examples into multiple lines, fix one quote in ms example, ...)

Motivation

  • Makes examples a bit clearer and consistent.
  • All browsers are going to have MathML in the short future (or can already be enabled by a flag), using EmbedLiveSample is more convenient for maintenance of the wiki pages.

Additional details

N/A

Related issues and pull requests

N/A
items.title: Use EmbedLiveSample for all MathML examples

items.content_html:
Fixes #12675

  • Docs: Correct statement under Add HTML for the ItemComponent heading

  1. "The double curly braces, {{}}, in the and for the checkbox
    signifies Angular's interpolation" is replaced with The double curly braces,
    {{}}, in the for the checkbox
    signifies Angular's interpolation

  2. Refactor editable property in HTML for better readability and less confusion
    by setting editable to true in ItemComponentclass

  3. Exchange Boolean values for editable where applicable

  • Docs: Prepare the AppComponent heading
    add type parameter to remove method in AppCompponent class

  • Docs: Add logic to ItemComponent

  1. saveItem method parameter has no type. Set type to Item Interface.
  2. @input() item: Item has no initializer. Add non-null assertion operator (!) to fix
  3. @input() newItem: has no initializer. Add non-null assertion operator (!) to fix
  4. editable: set editable property to true in Item Component class setting editable to
    false in the class may lead to confusion in the HTML code

Note: Application will not compile without applying 1, 2 and 3

  • Docs: Use the ItemComponent in the AppComponent

  • Replace item variable with i

  • This is to avoid confusing the reader
    There's already an @input variable named item in the Item Component,
    using i let's the reader know that we are specifically referencing
    members of the items array, and not the item Input

  • Fix: fix typo
    typo has already been fixed and merged from issue #20473

Description

  • Changes aim to ensure better readability of tutorial for readers
  • Changes fix app compilation errors

Motivation

  • I just completed the Angular tutorial and I experienced some of the problems listed above.
  • My goal is to simplify the learning experience process for newcomers

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #12675
Relates to #20473
items.title: Angular: Creating an item component: Minor issues
